page.title: 18Tintinhull Glove Factory
page.content: The Glove Factory started in general use in 1880. Present owner Mr.Southcombe,started working there in 1937 with the original company now it is a limited company. There are thirty-six people working in the factory about sixteen working at home. Most of the gloves go to the parent company and they send some abroad. He uses only sheepskin for the gloves.The number of gloves they make in a week is 1680 pairs. In Mr. Southcombe's fathers company they made some gloves especially for Queen Mary and for some famous golfers. In the records it states that the rent paid for forty acres of land known as Welham's, situated between Tintinhull and Stoke -Sub-Hamdon, was one pair of gloves for the price of penny. R.Southcombe started the business in 1847 in his garden shed.
